title: ngAfterContentChecked() fires inconsistently for @Directive

Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... ### Description Doesn't work: `#{{ report?.referral?.id }}` But this, that I understand it is the workaround, works `#{{ report?.referral?.id }}` Thanks ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/... ## üî• Exception or Error 




 Cannot read property 'outlets' of null

<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->

* `@angular/bazel`

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...

`bazel-out` directory is created by bazel build but it is not ignored by Git. 
It is a compilation output similar to `tsc-out`.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.

Update gitignore file for bazel-out directory when `ng new --collection=@angular/bazel` (or `ng add @angular/bazel` in the future)

title: Language service ignores excluded files
body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/language-service ### Is this a regression? I'm not sure. ### Description In my demo project, I have `*.ts` files which I load dynically to render their code. As such, I don't need a warning like ¬ªComponent 'ExampleComponent' is not included in a module and will not be available inside a template.¬´ and similar. I've excluded these files (`**/*.example.ts`) both in the tslint config as well as in `angular.json`, but the language service seems to ignore these exclusions (excluding it from tslint works). ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/Airblader/angular-lsbug-demo Just open `foo.example.ts` and an IDE like WebStorm will show an error on the decorator. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 


     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 7.1.2
Node: 10.14.1
OS: linux x64
Angular: 7.1.2
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.11.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.11.2
@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr   0.11.2
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.11.2
@angular-devkit/build-webpack      0.11.2
@angular-devkit/core               7.1.2
@angular-devkit/schematics         7.1.2
@angular/language-service          7.1.4
@ngtools/json-schema               1.1.0
@ngtools/webpack                   7.1.2
@schematics/angular                7.1.2
@schematics/update                 0.11.2
ng-packagr                         4.4.5
rxjs                               6.3.3
typescript                         3.1.6
webpack                            4.23.1
**Anything else relevant?** Related to #13726, #25623, #27227

body:

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->

# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit:--> 
The guides do not have a result zip for each milestone/step, which would be ideal to check if your local code conforms to what this would be

This improvement would be ideal as well, for anyone who would like to start from any milestone without having to start all over from scratch

In my case, I'm following the [Routing & Navigation Guide](https://angular.io/guide/router) and some changes that I made, causes the application not to have the behavior expected. Since I am learning, I do not know in which milestone I diverged nor in which part of the code. I only have access to the final version, where the project structure is already very different from the milestone I am (Milestone 4: Crisis center feature)

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
I'm facing this issue in:
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit:--> https://angular.io/guide/router

### Reproduction Steps**
<!-- If applicable please list the steps to take to reproduce the issue -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit:-->
Not applicable

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
<!-- If applicable please describe the difference between the expected and actual behavior after following the repro steps. -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit:-->
It was expected that at the end of each milestone there would be a zip to download with all progress up to that point so I can know if I'm on the right track

Currently I only have access to the final version of the example

## üì∑Screenshot
Not applicable
<!-- Often a screenshot can help to capture the issue better than a long description. -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èupload a screenshot:-->


## üî• Exception or Error
Not applicable

## üåç  Your Environment

### Browser info
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èIs this a browser specific issue? If so, please specify the device, browser, and version. -->
This is not a browser specific issue

### Anything else relevant?
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èPlease provide additional info if necessary. -->

title: Non-inline styles not working: probably to do with Ivy Renderer
body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue might be caused by: the Ivy Renderer... ### Is this a regression? Nope. ### Description When using an Angular CLI generated project with the Ivy Renderer, ShadowDom encapsulation and with scss stylesheets enabled, the project does not respond to alterations in the scss. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Generate a new project using the following command in the Konsole application within an Ubuntu VM (using VirtualBox): `ng new OvalPlay --prefix op --routing --style scss --view-encapsulation ShadowDom --experimental-ivy` Add the following to the `app.component.html`: ```

A Polygon of Virtue

Throughout history polygons have been oppressed and taught that their number of sides was their only benefit to society. Snakes and smaller mammals were thought exempt. Yet it was so that the tyranny of the militant lines, whether straight, or where by nature or form they took on a prismatic curvature when viewed, has brought about terror on a scale never before anticipated. This is a site about the tyranny of lines that anyone can edit, except when I say they can't, which is when views expressed contradict views I hold concerning polygons. This site is not affiliated with either Polygon or their parent company Salon.com, nor is it involved in the arms deals with Iran and Saudi Arabia both Polygon and Salon.com participate willingly and knowingly in. Rather, it is a site concerned simply with angles of a base polygonal form, and nothing else.

``` And the following to the app.component.scss: `.op-main-content { border: 3px dashed green; background-color: blue; }` You will notice the div with the tag op-main-content does not take on these horrific shades, as I wanted it to. Instead you will need to add the following to the HTML: `style="border: 3px dashed green; background-color: blue;"` Nothing further should be required. ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment Angular CLI: 7.1.4 **Anything else relevant?**

title: docs(service-worker): update service worker configuration doc
body:

## Other information

As asked by @gkalpak in #27859

milestone.title: Backlog

body:
This new version of dgeni-packages gives the main (implemented)
overload of a method the correct id and aliases, which allow it to be
automatically linked.

See https://github.com/angular/dgeni-packages/commit/398f35da303a839525cdb5aa690de394e905b1d5

Closes #27821

title: Document that `whenStable` requires `await` within the test function

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

`whenStable` returns a promise.  If the test does not perform an `await` on the promise, any failure may be missed or propagate during `afterAll`.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

It is difficult to reproduce this reliably because of the async nature.

### What's the affected URL?

https://angular.io/guide/testing#more-async-tests

### Reproduction Steps

Any test with a failure inside the `whenStable` block.

### Expected vs Actual Behavior

Success of the test instead of failure, especially when there are additional tests run after.

title: refactor(ivy): avoid `transitiveScopesFor` function duplication in TestBed

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
TestBed used to have its own implementation of the `transitiveScopesFor` function, customized for TestBed needs (to compile NgModules). This change unifies the `transitiveScopesFor` function usage by importing it from the `jit/module.ts` script and adding extra argument to configure its behavior (how to compile NgModule), so that TestBed can leverage it.

Corresponding ticket: FW-902.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

title: feat(service-worker): add JSON schema for service worker config

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features) > not relevant
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features) (not relevant here) > not relevant


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Feature


## What is the current behavior?
No assistance/validation in editor for service worker config.

Issue Number: Fixes #19847 

With angular/angular-cli#13325, it will also fix angular/angular-cli#13324

## What is the new behavior?
Assistance/validation in editor for service worker config.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?
- [X] No

## Other information

The schema follows `@angular/service-worker` interfaces ([here](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/service-worker/config/src/in.ts)).

Descriptions come from the official documentation on angular.io ([here](https://angular.io/guide/service-worker-config)).

Default values have been verified in `@angular/service-worker` code ([here](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/f8096d499324cf0961f092944bbaedd05364eea1/packages/service-worker/config/src/generator.ts)).

I don't understand how the build works. When following the contributing guidelines, I can't see the static files that should be copied (like `safety-worker.js` and `schema.json`) in `dist` builds. **So this part have to be checked.**

As this is just an helper for development, this could be added in a patch version.

@gkalpak

title: @angular/elements creating is 7-10 times slower than native custom elements
body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/elements ### Is this a regression? dunno ### Description Creating custom elements via @angular/elements is extremely slow. Simple test with ~600 components shows 7-10x slowdown related to native custom element. @angular/elements with NgZone, prod mode 180ms creation + 220ms of raf hell ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1944061/50519599-cb2f6d80-0acc-11e9-95a5-68bab76206fd.png) @angular/elements without NgZone, prod mode 180ms creation + short raf mini-hell ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1944061/50519530-725fd500-0acc-11e9-860e-172f2cecbb7d.png) native custom element 20ms creation ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1944061/50519553-80adf100-0acc-11e9-9df0-50e2640ecdcb.png) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction @angular/elements without NgZone https://stackblitz.com/edit/content-assemble-angular-elements?file=app%2Fhello.component.ts for NgZone enabling comment out `{ ngZone: 'noop' }` in `main.ts` native custom elements https://stackblitz.com/edit/content-assemble-custom-elements?file=app%2Fhello.component.ts ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

7.1.4
**Anything else relevant?** It's not a synthetic case, we have a real case with thousands of lessons slides that are created in separate cms as html markup with a lot of components/exercises (usually 500-2k components nodes per slide). Currently we are using old aio approach with manual createComponent calls on appropriate nodes and its faster than using @angular/elements (https://stackblitz.com/edit/content-assemble-html-v2?file=app%2Fapp.component.ts 80ms for same example).

title: Aot compiler breaking string concatination
body:
Copied from https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/12258

<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [*] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [*] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions
<!--
Output from: `node --version`, `npm --version` and `ng --version`.
  Windows (7/8/10). Linux (incl. distribution). macOS (El Capitan? Sierra? High Sierra?)
-->
node: 
````
v10.5.0
````
npm: 
````
6.1.0
````
Angular:
````
Angular CLI: 6.0.8
Node: 10.5.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular:
...

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.6.8
@angular-devkit/core         0.6.8
@angular-devkit/schematics   0.6.8
@schematics/angular          0.6.8
@schematics/update           0.6.8
rxjs                         6.2.1
typescript                   2.7.2
````

### Repro steps
<!--
Simple steps to reproduce this bug.
Please include: commands run (incl args), packages added, related code changes.
A link to a sample repo would help too.
-->
1. create an Angular project
2. create a file which has a namespace with a const valueÔºö
src/app/const.ts
````
export namespace Const {
    export const Value = 'a';
}
````
3. create a lazy module, use the const value
src/app/a/a.module.ts
````
import { NgModule } from '@angular/core';
import { RouterModule } from '@angular/router';
import { Const } from '../const';

@NgModule({
  imports: [
    RouterModule.forChild([
      // BUG 
      { path: `${Const.Value}b` },
    ]),
  ]
})
export class AModule {
}
````
src/app/app.module.ts
````
import { BrowserModule } from '@angular/platform-browser';
import { NgModule } from '@angular/core';

import { AppComponent } from './app.component';
import { RouterModule } from '@angular/router';

@NgModule({
  declarations: [
    AppComponent
  ],
  imports: [
    BrowserModule,
    RouterModule.forRoot([
      {
        path: 'a',
        loadChildren: './a/a.module#AModule'
      },
    ]),
  ],
  providers: [],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent]
})
export class AppModule { }
````
4. run `ng build --prod`

### The log given by the failure
<!-- Normally this include a stack trace and some more information. -->

The output js file of AModule has wrong path value.
dist/<project_name>/0.fc3e9f73dd253ec7a2f8.js
````
(window.webpackJsonp=window.webpackJsonp||[]).push([[0],{KImX:function(n,t,a){"use strict";a.r(t);var c=a("CcnG"),o=function(){},r=a("pMnS"),u=a("ZYCi");a.d(t,"AModuleNgFactory",function(){return i});var i=c.Fa(o,[],function(n){return c.Na([c.Oa(512,c.j,c.V,[[8,[r.a]],[3,c.j],c.u]),c.Oa(1073742336,u.l,u.l,[[2,u.r],[2,u.k]]),c.Oa(1073742336,o,o,[]),c.Oa(1024,u.i,function(){return[[{path:"[object Object]b"}]]},[])])})}}]);
````
expect `{path:"ab"}` but result is `{path:"[object Object]b"}` 

### Desired functionality
<!--
What would like to see implemented?
What is the usecase?
-->


### Mention any other details that might be useful
<!-- Please include a link to the repo if this is related to an OSS project. -->
1. without "--prod" flag is correct
2. without namespace is correct
3. ` ${Const.Value}b ` and `Const.Value + 'b' ` are same

This is re-predicable using the ngc compiler directly.

//cc @fdragoon

title: Redirect to root url does not work when returning UrlTree from guard

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? No. ### Description I use a guard to protect a route. If the user is not allowed to access the route I'd like to redirect to the root url. I'm doing this by returning an UrlTree from the canActivate method. To get the UrlTree for the root url I'm calling router.parseUrl('/'). However when I navigate to the protected page the redirect to the root url does not happen. The protected page isn't displayed either and there are no errors in the console. If I change the guard to return router.parseUrl('/unauthorized') the redirect to the unauthorized page works as expected. I think this should also work for the root url. Am I missing something or is this a bug? ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction [https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-w72ytp](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-w72ytp) ## üî• Exception or Error None ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 7.1.4
Node: 10.13.0
OS: win32 x64

... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

The `RouterPreloader` now does not relies on external `setUpPreloading` calls.

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
All packages are effected by the output of `ngcc`


### Description

After running `ngcc` via `node_modules/.bin/ivy-ngcc` certain Angular decorators are being retained, this is break production builds with Build Optimzer https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/13261.


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

- Run ngcc against a node_modules/@angular directory
- Open node_modules/@angular/platform-browser/esm5/src/browser.js
```ts
var BrowserModule_1;
BrowserModule = BrowserModule_1 = tslib_1.__decorate([
	NgModule({ providers: BROWSER_MODULE_PROVIDERS, exports: [CommonModule, ApplicationModule] }),
	tslib_1.__param(0, Optional()), tslib_1.__param(0, SkipSelf()), tslib_1.__param(0, Inject(BrowserModule_1)),
	tslib_1.__metadata("design:paramtypes", [Object])
], BrowserModule);
return BrowserModule;
```

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
```
Node: 10.10.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.2.0-rc.0
```


**Anything else relevant?**
According to @IgorMinar, there should not be any Angular specific decorators after running `ngcc`.

title: new behavior for global ErrorHandler and uncaught errors from promises

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package Well I thought this was zone.js wrapping the errors, but I rolled zone back only zone and it didn't change. ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was 5.x ### Description Previously, unhandled errors from promises were handed to a custom error handler unchanged. But now, it seems the error is wrapped and you need to unwrap it to get the real error that's sitting on the "rejection" property of the error. The docs make no mention of this here https://angular.io/api/core/ErrorHandler and neither does any googling surprisingly. I noticed this only after upgrading from angular 5 to angular 7 and one of my e2e tests that relied on my general error handler started failing. The only workaround I found was to have something like this at the top of the error handler's handleError() method like this: ```typescript while(error.rejection) { error = error.rejection; } ``` but... 1. I'm quite sure there's a better way - now I have to type error as any 2. I'm not sure if there are any other situations that will require unwrapping (e.g. from observables?). Either way, if this was some kind of intentional feature, it's definitely a gotcha that I think should be mentioned (with the RIGHT way to handle it) in the doc link I pasted. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. follow the docs and implement a global error handler and try to handle unhandled requests uniformly - something like this: ```typescript @Injectable() export class SpiffyErrorHandlerService implements ErrorHandler { constructor(private injector: Injector, private snackBar: MatSnackBar) {} public handleError(error: Error) { if (error instanceof HttpErrorResponse) { if (error.status === 401) { this.snackBar.open( 'Oops. It looks like you tried to access a logged-in resource while logged out. Please log in again.', '', { duration: 3000 } ); } } } ``` 2. inject HttpClient 3. await this.http.get('/some-404-returning-url').toPromise(); ## üî• Exception or Error EXPECTED: error handler works, gets the HttpErrorResponse, and shows the snackbar ACTUAL: the HttpErrorResponse is on error.rejection instead of right on error. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 




Angular CLI: 7.1.2
Node: 10.14.2
OS: linux x64
Angular: 7.1.3
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router, service-worker
